total_impedance_ori_txt: R2 and Rd connected in parallel so Rc=R2*Rd/(R2+Rd)=750 Ohm
R1 and Rf connected in parallel so Re=R1*Rf/(R1+Rf)=750 Ohm
Rc and Re connected in series so Rb=Rc+Re=1500 Ohm
Rxyb and Rb connected in parallel so Ra=Rxyb*Rb/(Rxyb+Rb)=1000 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 1000 Ohm
total_impedance_txt: R2 and Rxya connected in parallel so Rc=R2*Rxya/(R2+Rxya)=750 Ohm
R1 and Rxyc connected in parallel so Re=R1*Rxyc/(R1+Rxyc)=750 Ohm
Rc and Re connected in series so Rb=Rc+Re=1500 Ohm
Rxyb and Rb connected in parallel so Ra=Rxyb*Rb/(Rxyb+Rb)=1000 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 1000 Ohm

request.text: What is the voltage on R1?

solution: This circuit can not be solved by using the standard series-parallel rules
The R5,R4,R3 components form a star connection. We will convert it to delta connection
So we can use standard series-parallel rules for impedance calculation
The new components will be: Rxya=3000.00 Ohm,Rxyb=3000.00 Ohm,Rxyc=3000.00 Ohm
The following formulas are used in the star to delta conversion:
Rxya=(R5*R4+R4*R3+R3*R5)/R3
Rxyb=(R5*R4+R4*R3+R3*R5)/R5
Rxyc=(R5*R4+R4*R3+R3*R5)/R4
This is a DC calculation
At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes (VS1)
R2 and Rxya connected in parallel so Rc=R2*Rxya/(R2+Rxya)=750 Ohm
R1 and Rxyc connected in parallel so Re=R1*Rxyc/(R1+Rxyc)=750 Ohm
Rc and Re connected in series so Rb=Rc+Re=1500 Ohm
Rxyb and Rb connected in parallel so Ra=Rxyb*Rb/(Rxyb+Rb)=1000 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 1000 Ohm
Now we calculate the voltage on R1
We know that the voltage between VS1 nodes is 5 V.
(1) The components Rxyb,Rb connected in parallel. The voltage on Rb is 5 V because the voltage on Ra is 5 V
(2) The components Rc,Re connected in series.
(2) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 5 V.
(2) Re is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Re is Re/Rb*5 V = 2.5 V.
(3) The components R1,Rxyc connected in parallel. The voltage on R1 is 2.5 V because the voltage on Re is 2.5 V
